body_content.explanation: in medieval Europe, the process by which a vassal (= a man who lived on land given to him by a powerful land owner in exchange for agreeing to fight for him) allowed someone else to use or live on part of their land:
examples: They granted lands to their immediate tenants, who granted them over to others by sub-infeudation.
This was a normal part of subinfeudations before the thirteenth century.
